ticket.title: Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is
ticket.original-body:
As of 2.3.3 assert_redirected_to warns you if you test against a partial hash of params, but it makes it very difficult to find that failing test. Here's a snip of the output from my functional tests running:
..............................................................................................................................................................DEPRECATION WARNING: Using assert_redirected_to with partial hash arguments is deprecated. Specify the full set arguments instead. (called from clean_backtrace at /Volumes/Inkling/gitinkling/vendor/rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/test_case.rb:114) .........................

version.title: Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is
Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is

version.body:
I have found this deprecation notice not to be reproducible. I found where it should be displayed, but have no idea what arguments to pass to make it happen.
Additionally, there does not seem to be a test for this deprecation in test/controllers/action_pack_assertions_test.rb
version.body-html:
I have found this deprecation notice not to be reproducible. I found where it should be displayed, but have no idea what arguments to pass to make it happen.

Additionally, there does not seem to be a test for this deprecation in test/controllers/action_pack_assertions_test.rb
version.title: Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is

version.body:
I take that back... verified:
Controller: @@@ ruby class MonkeysController < ApplicationController def index redirect_to :controller => 'monkeys', :action => :show
end
def show
end end @@@
Test: @@@ruby class MonkeysControllerTest < ActionController::TestCase test "assert_redirected_to" do get :index assert_redirected_to :action => :show end end @@@
And the output...
@@@ DEPRECATION WARNING: Using assert_redirected_to with partial hash arguments is deprecated. Specify the full set arguments instead. (called from clean_backtrace at /Users/nichoj/code/experimental/2340-verification/vendor/rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/test_case.rb:114) @@@
version.body-html:
I take that back... verified:

Controller:

class MonkeysController < ApplicationController
  def index







redirect_to :controller => 'monkeys', :action => :show





  end



  def show



  end
end

Test:
@@@ruby class MonkeysControllerTest < ActionController::TestCase
test "assert_redirected_to" do

get :index
assert_redirected_to :action => :show

end end


And the output...
DEPRECATION WARNING: Using assert_redirected_to with partial hash arguments is deprecated. Specify the full set arguments instead. (called from clean_backtrace at /Users/nichoj/code/experimental/2340-verification/vendor/rails/actionpack/lib/action_controller/test_case.rb:114)
version.title: Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is

version.body: Josh is working on changing the output to include file and line number.
version.body-html: Josh is working on changing the output to include file and line number.
version.title: Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is

version.body: So, I've attached a patch that tries to use backtrace_cleaner for Deprecation. It works for the example case, but there's a few tests it seems to break, when it enters the cleaning process.
version.body-html: So, I've attached a patch that tries to use backtrace_cleaner for Deprecation. It works for the example case, but there's a few tests it seems to break, when it enters the cleaning process.
version.title: Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is

version.body: I opened #3015 as a more general case of this issue, and included a better patch.
version.body-html: I opened #3015 as a more general case of this issue, and included a better patch.

version.title: Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is

version.body:
I'm a little confused why you'd go and apply super-specific fix for this, ie assert_redirected_to, when there's a fix for a more general problem of Deprecation.warn reporting the wrong line.
I mean, I guess it's technically fixed for this particular reporting, but why make it brittle to what's calling it, and also having it remain for everything else using Deprecation.warn?
version.body-html:
I'm a little confused why you'd go and apply super-specific fix for this, ie assert_redirected_to, when there's a fix for a more general problem of Deprecation.warn reporting the wrong line.

I mean, I guess it's technically fixed for this particular reporting, but why make it brittle to what's calling it, and also having it remain for everything else using Deprecation.warn?
version.title: Deprecation warning for assert_redirected_to doesn't tell you where the offending code is

version.body: Because it's quick and easy and your better, more general fix was not available yet!
version.body-html:
Because it's quick and easy and your better, more general fix was not
available yet!
